revised_title: Magnetic Inclination, Force, and Declination in the Caribee Islands
tldr: This article presents the results of magnetic element determinations in the Caribee Islands, West Indies, conducted in August 1886. The observations were made using magnetometer Elliott Ho. 61 and Dip Circle Dover 83. The author also discusses the resistance of electrolytic cells and the electrolytic deposition of copper. The findings may be affected by local volcanic disturbances.
